name: Pan-Seared & Basted NY Striploin
instructions: Let the steak rest at room temperature for about 30 minutes.
Pat dry with paper towels and season both sides generously with kosher salt and black pepper.
Heat a stainless steel skillet over medium-high heat. Add the neutral oil.
Once the oil is shimmering, place the steak in the pan and sear undisturbed for about 2–3 minutes per side, depending on thickness.
Begin checking internal temperature. Once the steak reaches around 90–95°F (32–35°C), reduce the heat to medium or medium-low to avoid burning the butter.
Add butter, smashed garlic, thyme, and rosemary to the pan.
Tilt the pan and use a spoon to baste the steak with the melted butter and aromatics while continuing to cook.
Continue basting and flipping until the steak reaches an internal temperature of 125–128°F (52–53°C).
Remove the steak from the pan and let it rest under foil for 5 minutes. It will rise to medium-rare (130–135°F / 54–57°C) as it rests.
Discard the garlic and herbs from the pan if making a pan sauce.

storage_tips.room_temp: Not recommended. Steak should be refrigerated after cooling.
storage_tips.freezing_cooked: Wrap tightly and freeze for up to 2 months. Best if sliced before freezing for quicker reheating.
